title: Search for an employee file
content: Types of research To efficiently search for an employee file, you have several options. Click the Employee menu, then choose Search:By the last name: enter the family name directly: LAST_NAMEBy the first name: write a comma before entering the first time: ,FIRST_NAMEBy last name and first name: write the family name first, then space, then the first name: LAST_NAME FIRST_NAMEBy Employee number: do # followed by the Employee Number: #EMPLOYEE_NUMBERBy Badge number : do ! follows by the badge number : !BADGE"Include Inactive Employees"Inactive employees are, in general, those who are:Work stoppageParental leaveSick leaveFor more information on employee status, please consult this article.To learn more about how to change the employee status, click here."Include hidden Employees"Hidden employees are:Those who do not appear in schedules, timesheets or reportsThose who no longer work for you (employees with departure date)For more information on employee status, please consult this article.To close an employee's file, click here.To restore the status of the employee who returns to work for you, consult this article.Filter your employee file searches by access profileIn the Employees menu, click on Search,Check the box(es) for the desired access profile(s),Then click Search, and the list of matching employee records will appearHelpful?00Updated: 2 years ago Share :
